summary: This bill, the Optimizing Postpartum Outcomes Act of 2025, directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue guidance on Medicaid coverage for pelvic health services during the prenatal and postpartum periods. It mandates a GAO study on coverage gaps and establishes a postpartum pelvic health education campaign by the CDC, focusing on educating healthcare professionals and postpartum women about examinations and physical therapy. The bill also defines 'postpartum period,' 'covered pelvic health services,' 'pelvic floor examination,' and 'pelvic health physical therapy,' and authorizes appropriations of $2 million annually for the education campaign.
